it.polimi.automata

Class BA

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.automata.BA
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IBA, IntersectionBA

    public class BA
extends Object
implements Cloneable

    Represents a Buchi Automaton. The BA class contains the description of a Buchi Automaton. The BA class is based on the DirectedPseudograph class of the JGrapT library. The DirectedPseudograph allows to create a non-simple directed graph in which both graph loops and multiple edges are permitted. The BA class maintains the set of initial states, the set of accepting states, and the alphabet of the Buchi Automaton. The constructor of the BA requires to specify the transition factory to be used, depending on whether the BA is used to represent the model or the claim to be checked. The BA class provides methods to access the elements of the BA, such as the one that allow to get the successors of a state (getSuccessors()) to obtain the initial states (getInitialStates()).

    Author:
    claudiomenghi

      • addProposition

        public void addProposition(@NonNull rwth.i2.ltl2ba4j.model.IGraphProposition proposition)
        adds the propositions to the proposition of the Buchi automaton. If a proposition is already contained in the set of characters of the Buchi automaton no actions are performed
        Parameters:
        proposition - the character to be added to the Buchi automaton
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - is generated if the character to be added is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the proposition is negated

      • addTransition

        public void addTransition(@NonNull State source,
                          @NonNull State destination,
                          @NonNull Transition transition)
        add the transition t which connects the source and the destination state. The ille
        Parameters:
        source - is the source of the transition
        destination - is the destination of the transition
        transition - is the transition to be added
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the source state the destination state or the transition is null
        IllegalArgumentException - is generated in one of the following cases: 1) the label of the transition is not contained in the alphabet of the automaton 2) the source is not contained into the set of the states of the automaton 3) the destination of the transition is not contained into the set of the states of the automaton 4) a transition that connect source to the destination is already present

      • isPredecessor

        public boolean isPredecessor(@NonNull State source,
                             @NonNull State destination)
        check if the state source is a predecessor of the state destination, i.e., there exist a transition from the source to the destination
        Parameters:
        source - the source of the transition
        destination - the destination of the transition
        Returns:
        true if and oly if the destination is a successor of the source
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the source of the destination is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the source or the destination are not contained into the set of the states of the BA

      • getTransitions

        public @NonNull Set<Transition> getTransitions(@NonNull State source,
                                               @NonNull State destination)
        returns the transition between the source and the destination state. if no transition is present an Illegal argument exception is thrown
        Parameters:
        source - is the source state of the transition
        destination - is the destination state of the transition
        Returns:
        the transition between the source and the destination state
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the source state or the destination state is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the source or the destination state is not a state of the Buchi automaton or if it does not exists a transition that connect the source and the destination state

      • isSuccessor

        public boolean isSuccessor(@NonNull State source,
                           @NonNull State destination)
        returns true if the destination is a direct successor of of the source, i.e., there exists A transition that connect the source and the destination. Otherwise a false value is returned
        Parameters:
        source - is the source of the transition
        destination - is the destination of the transition
        Returns:
        true if there exists a transition between the source and the destination, false otherwise
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the source and the destination are null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the source or the destination are not contained into the set of the states of the automaton

        Parameters:
        s - the state to be stuttered
        Throws:

        IllegalArgumentException - if the state s is not contained into the set of the states of the automaton

      • size

        public int size()
        returns the size of the automaton: the number of transitions plus the number of the states
        Returns:
